text: Loads SVG files with options for importing stroke/fill data, assigning groups and cleaning/converting bezier paths.

Houdini is able to load .ai (Adobe Illustrator) files but it’s capabilities are limited.
This node allows import of SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) files which can be output by a variety of programs.
It loads useful stroke/fill data into primitive attributes.
(Limitation: Does not currently support <ellipse> elements. Convert any ellipses into bezier paths before saving SVG)

SVG files are saved in 'point' coordinates and geometry is usually a several hundred points in size.
    The default scaling of 0.01 is usually a sensible scale factor

Complex bezier paths are created from a collection of segments. Often these paths have a mix of bezier and linear segments, and in this case attempting to load all segments with the bezier reader breaks the curve.  
    By forcing each segment to be loaded individually the shape can be retained accurately.
Converts all bezier curves into resampled polylines, according to the 'Conversion Detail' parameter
Accompanies the 'Force Single Segments' option to recombine indivudual segments into larger curves
Performs hole-generation on nested closed shapes
Offsets any curves which have a stroke-width attribute to correctly match the SVG display

title: SVG Importer
summary: Loads SVG files with options for importing stroke/fill data, assigning groups and cleaning/converting bezier paths.
